title: Older Emails Not Retrieved
content:
I'm trying to get older messages from my gmail, AOL and yahoo accounts on a new computer. Currently, I'm only getting messages from about 2021 but I have looked into the underlying accounts and all of the messages for pre-2021 are still there. I need to go back till at least 2017, but I really would like everything.

I've done the following: a. Account Settings - Synchronization and Storage - Disk Space - elected "Synchronize all messages locally regardless of age" - ALSO I have plenty of disk space so storage is not an issue. b. Same as a elected "dont delete any messages"

Any other suggestions?

Thanks.
creator: hdallen10022

title: Calendar Printing Tweaks
content:
Running Thunderbird 128.4, working good, quite happy with the Calendar feature.

When printing a monthly calendar, the output includes the previous and following month dates, events, and tasks in the printout. If the first of the month falls on a Saturday, then the preceding days Sunday-Friday are from the previous month, and they are shown and printed in the output. Likewise at the end of the month.

Is it possible to change a setting so that these cells are blanked or greyed out in some manner when printing? Or is there some add-on that further lets you tweak calendar options?

Thanks in advance.
creator: karlbensmiller

title: Emails not downloading from Office365/Outlook
content:
Since the last Microsoft update a couple of weeks ago emails are being held on the Office365 server instead of downloading into Thunderbird (which I love to use - I hate Outlook). So I logged in on-line to Outlook and found if I added email addresses to the on-line Outlook Contact list (address book) that usually they would then come through. I had to add hundreds of emails, but many are still not downloading. Some would pop up and ask to be added to a safe sender's list (all in the on-line office 365/outlook).

Do you know what is going on and why all my emails will not download? Also I can no longer access the spam folder in Thunderbird. It shows that there is spam, there is a number on the folder, but I can only view those spam messages by logging into Office365 and using the on-line Outlook.

I know that I am not the only one with this issue as I have talked to others who also are experiencing this even people using Outlook and not Thunderbird. I do not have any issue with my Earthlink.net email accounts, so I know it is a Microsoft created issue.

Please let me know if you know a work-a-round for this issue. Thanks so much! Jennifer Geib
creator: jengeib

title: Send function not working
content: When trying to send an email the following message is displayed "Sending of the message failed An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded; Relay Denied- Unauthorised. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again" On previous occasions when this message has displayed the fix was to reset my router. This is now not fixing the issue. I need to get the send function operational again, and cannot see any issue with my email address. If the email address was incorrect I would expect to not receive any emails

title: Sluggishness of thunderbird mail-client
content:
A couple of months ago Thunderbird started being very slow in multiple situations. I use POP3 and download all mails. I have fairly big mailboxes, some of them up to 2½ GB.

1) Downloading e-mails is slow.

But the worst is this one:

2) Clicking on unread mails first time. This can easily take 10 secs, where the app goes "not responding" and finally "Loading message...." With 10 new mails, it is a lot of wasted time.

3) Dragging mails from one mailbox to another Some of the same behaviour as above.

I have tried to compact mailboxes, but that doesn't help.

I am on release 128.4.1esr (32-bit), windows 10.
creator: uffe.kousgaard

title: Calendar invitations end up in the wrong calendar
content:
Hello,

I face an issue with calendar invitations. I have a bunch of calendars, all CalDAV, for different purposes. Now when I recieve an invite, to one of my email adresses, the invitation ends up in the wrong calendar.

There are some other questions related to this problem around, but they all seem to be solved by setting the correct E-mail adress in the calendar setting which does not work in my case. Infact I changed the email adress of the wrong calendar to "none" and another calendar is linked to the correct e-mail. I already resarted Thunderbird, to check if that makes a difference.

Further, I would in general like to have the option to switch invited appointments from one to another calendar sometimes. As said I use several different calendars an sometimes invites come in from one e-mail adress taht would fit better to a different calendar. Is there a way to do that? For what I see now there is now way to assign an invited appointment manually to a different calendar.

Thanks for your help,

the-guzzi
creator: the-guzzi
